   20: 
   21: -module(filelib_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   26: 	 wildcard_one/1,wildcard_two/1,wildcard_errors/1,
   27: 	 fold_files/1,otp_5960/1,ensure_dir_eexist/1,ensure_dir_symlink/1,
   28:          ensure_path_single_dir/1, ensure_path_nested_dirs/1,
   29:          ensure_path_binary_args/1, ensure_path_symlink/1,
   30:          ensure_path_relative_path/1, ensure_path_relative_path_dot_dot/1,
   31:          ensure_path_invalid_path/1,
   32: 	 wildcard_symlink/1, is_file_symlink/1, file_props_symlink/1,
   33:          find_source/1, find_source_subdir/1, find_source_otp/1,
   34:          safe_relative_path/1, safe_relative_path_links/1]).
   35: 
   36: -import(lists, [foreach/2]).
   37: 
   38: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   39: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   40: 
   41: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   42: 
   43: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   44:     Config.
   45: 
   46: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   47:     ok.
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [wildcard_one, wildcard_two, wildcard_errors,
   55:      fold_files, otp_5960, ensure_dir_eexist, ensure_dir_symlink,
   56:      ensure_path_single_dir, ensure_path_nested_dirs, ensure_path_binary_args,
   57:      ensure_path_symlink, ensure_path_relative_path,
   58:      ensure_path_relative_path_dot_dot,
   59:      ensure_path_invalid_path,
   60:      wildcard_symlink, is_file_symlink, file_props_symlink,
   61:      find_source, find_source_subdir, find_source_otp,
   62:      safe_relative_path, safe_relative_path_links].
   63: 
   64: groups() -> 
   65:     [].
   66: 
   67: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: 
   80: wildcard_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
   82:     Dir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "wildcard_one"),
   83:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
   84:     do_wildcard_1(Dir,
   85: 		  fun(Wc) ->
   86: 			  filelib:wildcard(Wc, Dir, erl_prim_loader)
   87: 		  end),
   88:     file:set_cwd(Dir),
   89:     do_wildcard_1(Dir,
   90: 		  fun(Wc) ->
   91: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
   92: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(disable_prefix_opt(Wc)),
   93: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(Wc, erl_prim_loader),
   94: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(Wc, "."),
   95: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(Wc, Dir),
   96: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(disable_prefix_opt(Wc), Dir),
   97: 			  L = filelib:wildcard(Wc, Dir++"/.")
   98: 		  end),
   99:     file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  100:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  101:     ok.
  102: 
  103: wildcard_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  104:     Dir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "wildcard_two"),
  105:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  106:     do_wildcard_1(Dir, fun(Wc) -> io:format("~p~n",[{Wc,Dir, X = filelib:wildcard(Wc, Dir)}]),X  end),
  107:     do_wildcard_1(Dir, fun(Wc) -> filelib:wildcard(Wc, Dir++"/") end),
  108:     do_wildcard_1(Dir, fun(Wc) -> filelib:wildcard(Wc, Dir++"/.") end),
  109:     case os:type() of
  110: 	{win32,_} ->
  111: 	    ok;
  112: 	_ ->
  113: 	    do_wildcard_1(Dir, fun(Wc) -> filelib:wildcard(Wc, "//"++Dir) end)
  114:     end,
  115:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  116:     ok.
  117: 
  118: wildcard_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     wcc("{", missing_delimiter),
  120:     wcc("{a", missing_delimiter),
  121:     wcc("{a,", missing_delimiter),
  122:     wcc("{a,b", missing_delimiter),
  123:     ok.
  124: 
  125: wcc(Wc, Error) ->
  126:     {'EXIT',{{badpattern,Error},
  127: 	     [{filelib,compile_wildcard,1,_}|_]}} =
  128: 	(catch filelib:compile_wildcard(Wc)),
  129:     {'EXIT',{{badpattern,Error},
  130: 	     [{filelib,wildcard,1,_}|_]}} = (catch filelib:wildcard(Wc)),
  131:     {'EXIT',{{badpattern,Error},
  132: 	     [{filelib,wildcard,2,_}|_]}} = (catch filelib:wildcard(Wc, ".")).
  133: 
  134: disable_prefix_opt([_,$:|_]=Wc) ->
  135:     Wc;
  136: disable_prefix_opt([C|Wc]) when $a =< C, C =< $z; C =:= $@ ->
  137:     %% There is an optimization for patterns that have a literal prefix
  138:     %% (such as "lib/compiler/ebin/*"). Test that we'll get the same result
  139:     %% if we disable that optimization.
  140:     [$[, C, $] | Wc];
  141: disable_prefix_opt(Wc) ->
  142:     Wc.
  143: 
  144: do_wildcard_1(Dir, Wcf0) ->
  145:     do_wildcard_2(Dir, Wcf0),
  146:     Wcf = fun(Wc0) ->
  147: 		  Wc = Dir ++ "/" ++ Wc0,
  148: 		  L = Wcf0(Wc),
  149: 		  [subtract_dir(N, Dir) || N <- L]
  150: 	  end,
  151:     do_wildcard_2(Dir, Wcf).
  152: 
  153: subtract_dir([C|Cs], [C|Dir]) -> subtract_dir(Cs, Dir);
  154: subtract_dir("/"++Cs, []) -> Cs.
  155: 
  156: do_wildcard_2(Dir, Wcf) ->
  157:     %% Basic wildcards.
  158:     All = ["abc","abcdef","glurf"],
  159:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  160:     All = Wcf("*"),
  161:     ["abc","abcdef"] = Wcf("a*"),
  162:     ["abc","abcdef"] = Wcf("abc*"),
  163:     ["abcdef"] = Wcf("abc???"),
  164:     ["abcdef"] = Wcf("abcd*"),
  165:     ["abcdef"] = Wcf("*def"),
  166:     ["abcdef","glurf"] = Wcf("{*def,gl*}"),
  167:     ["abc","abcdef"] = Wcf("a*{def,}"),
  168:     ["abc","abcdef"] = Wcf("a*{,def}"),
  169: 
  170:     %% Constant wildcard.
  171:     ["abcdef"] = Wcf("abcdef"),
  172: 
  173:     %% Negative tests.
  174:     [] = Wcf("b*"),
  175:     [] = Wcf("bufflig"),
  176: 
  177:     del(Files),
  178:     do_wildcard_3(Dir, Wcf).
  179: 
  180: do_wildcard_3(Dir, Wcf) ->
  181:     %% Some character sets.
  182:     All = ["a01","a02","a03","b00","c02","d19"],
  183:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  184:     All = Wcf("[a-z]*"),
  185:     All = Wcf("[a-d]*"),
  186:     All = Wcf("[adbc]*"),
  187:     All = Wcf("?[0-9][0-9]"),
  188:     All = Wcf("?[0-1][0-39]"),
  189:     All = Wcf("[abcdefgh][10][01239]"),
  190:     ["a01","a02","a03","b00","c02"] = Wcf("[a-z]0[0-3]"),
  191:     [] = Wcf("?[a-z][0-39]"),
  192:     del(Files),
  193:     do_wildcard_4(Dir, Wcf).
  194: 
  195: do_wildcard_4(Dir, Wcf) ->
  196:     %% More character sets: tricky characters.
  197:     All = ["a-","aA","aB","aC","a[","a]"],
  198:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  199:     All = Wcf("a[][A-C-]"),
  200:     ["a-"] = Wcf("a[-]"),
  201:     ["a["] = Wcf("a["),
  202:     del(Files),
  203:     do_wildcard_5(Dir, Wcf).
  204: 
  205: do_wildcard_5(Dir, Wcf) ->
  206:     Dirs = ["xa","blurf","yyy"],
  207:     foreach(fun(D) -> ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, D)) end, Dirs),
  208:     All = ["blurf/nisse","xa/arne","xa/kalle","yyy/arne"],
  209:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  210: 
  211:     %% Test.
  212:     All = Wcf("*/*"),
  213:     ["blurf/nisse","xa/arne","xa/kalle"] = Wcf("{blurf,xa}/*"),
  214:     ["xa/arne","yyy/arne"] = Wcf("*/arne"),
  215:     ["blurf/nisse"] = Wcf("*/nisse"),
  216:     [] = Wcf("mountain/*"),
  217:     [] = Wcf("xa/gurka"),
  218:     ["blurf/nisse"] = Wcf("blurf/nisse"),
  219: 
  220:     %% Cleanup
  221:     del(Files),
  222:     foreach(fun(D) -> ok = file:del_dir(filename:join(Dir, D)) end, Dirs),
  223:     do_wildcard_6(Dir, Wcf).
  224: 
  225: do_wildcard_6(Dir, Wcf) ->
  226:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, "xbin")),
  227:     All = ["xbin/a.x","xbin/b.x","xbin/c.x"],
  228:     Files = mkfiles(All, Dir),
  229:     All = Wcf("xbin/*.x"),
  230:     All = Wcf("xbin/*"),
  231:     ["xbin"] = Wcf("*"),
  232:     All = Wcf("*/*"),
  233:     del(Files),
  234:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:join(Dir, "xbin")),
  235:     do_wildcard_7(Dir, Wcf).
  236: 
  237: do_wildcard_7(Dir, Wcf) ->
  238:     Dirs = ["blurf","xa","yyy"],
  239:     SubDirs = ["blurf/nisse"],
  240:     foreach(fun(D) ->
  241: 		    ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, D))
  242: 	    end, Dirs ++ SubDirs),
  243:     All = ["blurf/nisse/baz","xa/arne","xa/kalle","yyy/arne"],
  244:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  245: 
  246:     %% Test.
  247:     Listing = Wcf("**"),
  248:     ["blurf","blurf/nisse","blurf/nisse/baz",
  249:      "xa","xa/arne","xa/kalle","yyy","yyy/arne"] = Listing,
  250:     Listing = Wcf("**/*"),
  251:     ["xa/arne","yyy/arne"] = Wcf("**/arne"),
  252:     ["blurf/nisse"] = Wcf("**/nisse"),
  253:     [] = Wcf("mountain/**"),
  254: 
  255:     %% Cleanup
  256:     del(Files),
  257:     foreach(fun(D) ->
  258: 		    ok = file:del_dir(filename:join(Dir, D))
  259: 	    end, SubDirs ++ Dirs),
  260:     do_wildcard_8(Dir, Wcf).
  261: 
  262: do_wildcard_8(Dir, Wcf) ->
  263:     Dirs0 = ["blurf"],
  264:     Dirs1 = ["blurf/nisse"],
  265:     Dirs2 = ["blurf/nisse/a", "blurf/nisse/b"],
  266:     foreach(fun(D) ->
  267: 		    ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, D))
  268: 	    end, Dirs0 ++ Dirs1 ++ Dirs2),
  269:     All = ["blurf/nisse/a/1.txt", "blurf/nisse/b/2.txt", "blurf/nisse/b/3.txt"],
  270:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  271: 
  272:     %% Test.
  273:     All = Wcf("**/blurf/**/*.txt"),
  274: 
  275:     %% Cleanup
  276:     del(Files),
  277:     foreach(fun(D) ->
  278: 		    ok = file:del_dir(filename:join(Dir, D))
  279: 	    end, Dirs2 ++ Dirs1 ++ Dirs0),
  280:     do_wildcard_9(Dir, Wcf).
  281: 
  282: do_wildcard_9(Dir, Wcf) ->
  283:     Dirs0 = ["lib","lib/app","lib/app/ebin"],
  284:     Dirs = [filename:join(Dir, D) || D <- Dirs0],
  285:     [ok = file:make_dir(D) || D <- Dirs],
  286:     Files0 = [filename:join("lib/app/ebin", F++".bar") ||
  287: 		 F <- ["abc","foo","foobar"]],
  288:     Files = [filename:join(Dir, F) || F <- Files0],
  289:     [ok = file:write_file(F, <<"some content\n">>) || F <- Files],
  290:     Files0 = Wcf("lib/app/ebin/*.bar"),
  291: 
  292:     %% Cleanup.
  293:     del(Files),
  294:     [ok = file:del_dir(D) || D <- lists:reverse(Dirs)],
  295:     do_wildcard_10(Dir, Wcf).
  296: 
  297: %% ERL-451/OTP-14577: Escape characters using \\.
  298: do_wildcard_10(Dir, Wcf) ->
  299:     All0 = ["{abc}","abc","def","---","z--","@a,b","@c"],
  300:     All = case os:type() of
  301:               {unix,_} ->
  302:                   %% '?' is allowed in file names on Unix, but
  303:                   %% not on Windows.
  304:                   ["?q"|All0];
  305:               _ ->
  306:                   All0
  307:           end,
  308:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  309: 
  310:     ["{abc}"] = Wcf("\\{a*"),
  311:     ["{abc}"] = Wcf("\\{abc}"),
  312:     ["abc","def","z--"] = Wcf("[a-z]*"),
  313:     ["---","abc","z--"] = Wcf("[a\\-z]*"),
  314:     ["@a,b","@c"] = Wcf("@{a\\,b,c}"),
  315:     ["@c"] = Wcf("@{a,b,c}"),
  316: 
  317:     case os:type() of
  318:         {unix,_} ->
  319:             ["?q"] = Wcf("\\?q");
  320:         _ ->
  321:             [] = Wcf("\\?q")
  322:     end,
  323: 
  324:     del(Files),
  325:     wildcard_11(Dir, Wcf).
  326: 
  327: %% ERL-ERL-1029/OTP-15987: Fix problems with "@/.." and ".." in general.
  328: wildcard_11(Dir, Wcf) ->
  329:     Dirs0 = ["@","@dir","dir@"],
  330:     Dirs = [filename:join(Dir, D) || D <- Dirs0],
  331:     _ = [ok = file:make_dir(D) || D <- Dirs],
  332:     Files0 = ["@a","b@","x","y","z"],
  333:     Files = mkfiles(Files0, Dir),
  334: 
  335:     ["@","@a","@dir","b@","dir@","x","y","z"] = Wcf("*"),
  336:     ["@"] = Wcf("@"),
  337:     ["@","@a","@dir"] = Wcf("@*"),
  338:     ["@/..","@dir/.."] = Wcf("@*/.."),
  339:     ["@/../@","@/../@a","@/../@dir",
  340:      "@dir/../@","@dir/../@a","@dir/../@dir"] = Wcf("@*/../@*"),
  341: 
  342:     %% Non-directories followed by "/.." should not match any files.
  343:     [] = Wcf("@a/.."),
  344:     [] = Wcf("x/.."),
  345: 
  346:     %% Cleanup.
  347:     del(Files),
  348:     [ok = file:del_dir(D) || D <- Dirs],
  349:     ok.
  350: 
  351: fold_files(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  352:     Dir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "fold_files"),
  353:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  354:     Dirs = [filename:join(Dir, D) || D <- ["blurf","blurf/blarf"]],
  355:     foreach(fun(D) -> ok = file:make_dir(D) end, Dirs),
  356:     All = ["fb.txt","ko.txt",
  357: 	   "blurf/nisse.text","blurf/blarf/aaa.txt","blurf/blarf/urfa.txt"],
  358:     Files = mkfiles(lists:reverse(All), Dir),
  359: 
  360:     %% Test.
  361:     Files0 = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "^", false,
  362: 				fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  363:     same_lists(["fb.txt","ko.txt"], Files0, Dir),
  364: 
  365:     Files1 = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "^", true,
  366: 				fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  367:     same_lists(All, Files1, Dir),
  368: 
  369:     Files2 = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "[.]text$", true,
  370: 				fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  371:     same_lists(["blurf/nisse.text"], Files2, Dir),
  372: 
  373: 
  374:     Files3 = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "^..[.]", true,
  375: 				fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  376:     same_lists(["fb.txt","ko.txt"], Files3, Dir),
  377: 
  378:     Files4 = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "^ko[.]txt$", true,
  379: 				fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  380:     same_lists(["ko.txt"], Files4, Dir),
  381:     Files4 = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "^ko[.]txt$", false,
  382: 				fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  383: 
  384:     [] = filelib:fold_files(Dir, "^$", true,
  385: 			    fun(H, T) -> [H|T] end, []),
  386: 
  387:     %% Cleanup
  388:     del(Files),
  389:     foreach(fun(D) -> ok = file:del_dir(D) end, lists:reverse(Dirs)),
  390:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir).
  391: 
  392: same_lists(Expected0, Actual0, BaseDir) ->
  393:     Expected = [filename:absname(N, BaseDir) || N <- lists:sort(Expected0)],
  394:     Actual = lists:sort(Actual0),
  395:     Expected = Actual.
  396: 
  397: mkfiles([H|T], Dir) ->
  398:     Name = filename:join(Dir, H),
  399:     Garbage = [31+rand:uniform(95) || _ <- lists:seq(1, rand:uniform(1024))],
  400:     file:write_file(Name, Garbage),
  401:     [Name|mkfiles(T, Dir)];
  402: mkfiles([], _) -> [].
  403: 
  404: del([H|T]) ->
  405:     ok = file:delete(H),
  406:     del(T);
  407: del([]) -> ok.
  408: 
  409: %% Test that filelib:ensure_dir/1 returns ok or {error,Reason}.
  410: otp_5960(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  411:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  412:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "otp_5960_dir"),
  413:     Name1 = filename:join(Dir, name1),
  414:     Name2 = filename:join(Dir, name2),
  415:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Name1), % parent is created
  416:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Name1), % repeating it should be OK
  417:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Name2), % parent already exists
  418:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Name2), % repeating it should be OK
  419:     Name3 = filename:join(Name1, name3),
  420:     {ok, FileInfo} = file:read_file_info(Dir),
  421:     case os:type() of
  422: 	{win32,_} ->
  423: 	    %% Not possibly to write protect directories on Windows
  424: 	    %% (at least not using file:write_file_info/2).
  425: 	    ok;
  426: 	_ ->
  427: 	    Mode = FileInfo#file_info.mode,
  428: 	    NoWriteMode = Mode - 8#00200 - 8#00020 - 8#00002,
  429: 	    ok = file:write_file_info(Dir, #file_info{mode=NoWriteMode}),
  430: 	    {error, _} = filelib:ensure_dir(Name3),
  431: 	    ok = file:write_file_info(Dir, #file_info{mode=Mode}),
  432: 	    ok
  433:     end.
  434: 
  435: ensure_dir_eexist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  436:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  437:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_dir_eexist"),
  438:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "same_name_as_file_and_dir"),
  439:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Name),
  440:     ok = file:write_file(Name, <<"some string\n">>),
  441: 
  442:     %% There already is a file with the name of the directory
  443:     %% we want to create.
  444:     NeedFile = filename:join(Name, "file"),
  445:     NeedFileB = filename:join(Name, <<"file">>),
  446:     {error, eexist} = filelib:ensure_dir(NeedFile),
  447:     {error, eexist} = filelib:ensure_dir(NeedFileB),
  448:     ok.
  449: 
  450: ensure_dir_symlink(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  451:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  452:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_dir_symlink"),
  453:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "same_name_as_file_and_dir"),
  454:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Name),
  455:     ok = file:write_file(Name, <<"some string\n">>),
  456:     %% With a symlink to the directory.
  457:     Symlink = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_dir_symlink_link"),
  458:     case file:make_symlink(Dir, Symlink) of
  459:         {error,enotsup} ->
  460:             {skip,"Symlinks not supported on this platform"};
  461:         {error,eperm} ->
  462:             {win32,_} = os:type(),
  463:             {skip,"Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"};
  464:         ok ->
  465:             SymlinkedName = filename:join(Symlink, "same_name_as_file_and_dir"),
  466:             ok = filelib:ensure_dir(SymlinkedName)
  467:     end.
  468: 
  469: ensure_path_single_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  470:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  471:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_single_dir"),
  472:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  473:     true = filelib:is_dir(Dir).
  474: 
  475: ensure_path_nested_dirs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  476:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  477:     BaseDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_nested_dirs"),
  478:     Path = filename:join(BaseDir, "foo/bar/baz"),
  479:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Path),
  480:     true = filelib:is_dir(Path).
  481: 
  482: ensure_path_binary_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  483:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  484:     BaseDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_binary_args"),
  485:     Path = filename:join(BaseDir, "foo/bar/baz"),
  486:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(list_to_binary(Path)),
  487:     true = filelib:is_dir(Path).
  488: 
  489: ensure_path_invalid_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  490:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  491:     BaseDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_invalid_path"),
  492:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(BaseDir),
  493:     FileName =  filename:join(BaseDir, "foo"),
  494:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, <<"eh?\n">>),
  495:     Path = filename:join(FileName, "foo/bar/baz"),
  496:     case filelib:ensure_path(Path) of
  497:         {error,enotdir} ->
  498:             ok;
  499:         {error,enoent} ->
  500:             %% The documentation has the following to say about the
  501:             %% `enotdir` error reason:
  502:             %%
  503:             %% "On some platforms, enoent is returned instead."
  504:             ok
  505:     end,
  506:     false = filelib:is_dir(Path).
  507: 
  508: ensure_path_relative_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  510:     BaseDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_relative_path"),
  511:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(BaseDir),
  512:     ok = file:set_cwd(BaseDir),
  513:     Path = filename:join(BaseDir, "foo/bar/baz"),
  514:     ok = filelib:ensure_path("foo/bar/baz"),
  515:     true = filelib:is_dir(Path).
  516: 
  517: ensure_path_relative_path_dot_dot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  518:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  519:     BaseDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_relative_path"),
  520:     SubDir = filename:join(BaseDir, "dot_dot"),
  521:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(SubDir),
  522:     ok = file:set_cwd(SubDir),
  523:     Path = filename:join(BaseDir, "foo/bar/baz"),
  524:     ok = filelib:ensure_path("../foo/bar/baz"),
  525:     true = filelib:is_dir(Path).
  526: 
  527: ensure_path_symlink(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  529:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_symlink"),
  530:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "same_name_as_file_and_dir"),
  531:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  532:     ok = file:write_file(Name, <<"some string\n">>),
  533:     %% With a symlink to the directory.
  534:     Symlink = filename:join(PrivDir, "ensure_path_symlink_link"),
  535:     case file:make_symlink(Dir, Symlink) of
  536:         {error,enotsup} ->
  537:             {skip,"Symlinks not supported on this platform"};
  538:         {error,eperm} ->
  539:             {win32,_} = os:type(),
  540:             {skip,"Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"};
  541:         ok ->
  542:             SymlinkedName = filename:join(Symlink, "same_name_as_file_and_dir"),
  543:             ok = filelib:ensure_dir(SymlinkedName)
  544:     end.
  545: 
  546: wildcard_symlink(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  547:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  548:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_wildcard_symlink"),
  549:     SubDir = filename:join(Dir, "sub"),
  550:     AFile = filename:join(SubDir, "a_file"),
  551:     Alias = filename:join(Dir, "symlink"),
  552:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  553:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  554:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, "not that big\n"),
  555:     case file:make_symlink(AFile, Alias) of
  556: 	{error, enotsup} ->
  557: 	    {skip, "Links not supported on this platform"};
  558: 	{error, eperm} ->
  559: 	    {win32,_} = os:type(),
  560: 	    {skip, "Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"};
  561: 	ok ->
  562: 	    ["sub","symlink"] =
  563: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))),
  564: 	    ["symlink"] =
  565: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "symlink"))),
  566: 	    ["sub","symlink"] =
  567: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"),
  568: 						erl_prim_loader)),
  569: 	    ["symlink"] =
  570: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "symlink"),
  571: 						erl_prim_loader)),
  572: 	    ["sub","symlink"] =
  573: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"),
  574: 						?PRIM_FILE)),
  575: 	    ["symlink"] =
  576: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "symlink"),
  577: 						?PRIM_FILE)),
  578: 	    ok = file:delete(AFile),
  579: 	    %% The symlink should still be visible even when its target
  580: 	    %% has been deleted.
  581: 	    ["sub","symlink"] =
  582: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))),
  583: 	    ["symlink"] =
  584: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "symlink"))),
  585: 	    ["sub","symlink"] =
  586: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"),
  587: 						erl_prim_loader)),
  588: 	    ["symlink"] =
  589: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "symlink"),
  590: 						erl_prim_loader)),
  591: 	    ["sub","symlink"] =
  592: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"),
  593: 						?PRIM_FILE)),
  594: 	    ["symlink"] =
  595: 		basenames(Dir, filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "symlink"),
  596: 						?PRIM_FILE)),
  597: 	    ok
  598:     end.
  599: 
  600: basenames(Dir, Files) ->
  601:     [begin
  602: 	 Dir = filename:dirname(F),
  603: 	 filename:basename(F)
  604:      end || F <- Files].
  605: 
  606: is_file_symlink(Config) ->
  607:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  608:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_is_file_symlink"),
  609:     SubDir = filename:join(Dir, "sub"),
  610:     AFile = filename:join(SubDir, "a_file"),
  611:     DirAlias = filename:join(Dir, "dir_symlink"),
  612:     FileAlias = filename:join(Dir, "file_symlink"),
  613:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  614:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  615:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, "not that big\n"),
  616:     case file:make_symlink(SubDir, DirAlias) of
  617: 	{error, enotsup} ->
  618: 	    {skip, "Links not supported on this platform"};
  619: 	{error, eperm} ->
  620: 	    {win32,_} = os:type(),
  621: 	    {skip, "Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"};
  622: 	ok ->
  623: 	    true = filelib:is_dir(DirAlias),
  624: 	    true = filelib:is_dir(DirAlias, erl_prim_loader),
  625: 	    true = filelib:is_dir(DirAlias, ?PRIM_FILE),
  626: 	    true = filelib:is_file(DirAlias),
  627: 	    true = filelib:is_file(DirAlias, erl_prim_loader),
  628: 	    true = filelib:is_file(DirAlias, ?PRIM_FILE),
  629: 	    ok = file:make_symlink(AFile,FileAlias),
  630: 	    true = filelib:is_file(FileAlias),
  631: 	    true = filelib:is_file(FileAlias, erl_prim_loader),
  632: 	    true = filelib:is_file(FileAlias, ?PRIM_FILE),
  633: 	    true = filelib:is_regular(FileAlias),
  634: 	    true = filelib:is_regular(FileAlias, erl_prim_loader),
  635: 	    true = filelib:is_regular(FileAlias, ?PRIM_FILE),
  636: 	    ok
  637:     end.
  638: 
  639: file_props_symlink(Config) ->
  640:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  641:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_file_props_symlink"),
  642:     AFile = filename:join(Dir, "a_file"),
  643:     Alias = filename:join(Dir, "symlink"),
  644:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  645:     ok = file:write_file(AFile, "not that big\n"),
  646:     case file:make_symlink(AFile, Alias) of
  647: 	{error, enotsup} ->
  648: 	    {skip, "Links not supported on this platform"};
  649: 	{error, eperm} ->
  650: 	    {win32,_} = os:type(),
  651: 	    {skip, "Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"};
  652: 	ok ->
  653: 	    {_,_} = LastMod = filelib:last_modified(AFile),
  654: 	    LastMod = filelib:last_modified(Alias),
  655: 	    LastMod = filelib:last_modified(Alias, erl_prim_loader),
  656: 	    LastMod = filelib:last_modified(Alias, ?PRIM_FILE),
  657: 	    FileSize = filelib:file_size(AFile),
  658: 	    FileSize = filelib:file_size(Alias),
  659: 	    FileSize = filelib:file_size(Alias, erl_prim_loader),
  660: 	    FileSize = filelib:file_size(Alias, ?PRIM_FILE)
  661:     end.
  662: 
  663: find_source(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     %% filelib:find_{file,source}() does not work if the files are
  665:     %% cover-compiled. To make sure that the test does not fail
  666:     %% when the STDLIB is cover-compiled, search for modules in
  667:     %% the compiler application.
  668: 
  669:     BeamFile = code:which(compile),
  670:     BeamName = filename:basename(BeamFile),
  671:     BeamDir = filename:dirname(BeamFile),
  672:     SrcName = filename:basename(BeamFile, ".beam") ++ ".erl",
  673: 
  674:     {ok, BeamFile} = filelib:find_file(BeamName, BeamDir),
  675:     {ok, BeamFile} = filelib:find_file(BeamName, BeamDir, []),
  676:     {ok, BeamFile} = filelib:find_file(BeamName, BeamDir, [{"",""},{"ebin","src"}]),
  677:     {error, not_found} = filelib:find_file(BeamName, BeamDir, [{"ebin","src"}]),
  678: 
  679:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_file(SrcName, BeamDir),
  680:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_file(SrcName, BeamDir, []),
  681:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_file(SrcName, BeamDir, [{"foo","bar"},{"ebin","src"}]),
  682:     {error, not_found} = filelib:find_file(SrcName, BeamDir, [{"",""}]),
  683: 
  684:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_source(BeamFile),
  685:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_source(BeamName, BeamDir),
  686:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_source(BeamName, BeamDir,
  687:                                          [{".erl",".yrl",[{"",""}]},
  688:                                           {".beam",".erl",[{"ebin","src"}]}]),
  689:     {error, not_found} = filelib:find_source(BeamName, BeamDir,
  690:                                               [{".erl",".yrl",[{"",""}]}]),
  691: 
  692:     {ok, ParserErl} = filelib:find_source(code:which(core_parse)),
  693:     ParserErlName = filename:basename(ParserErl),
  694:     ParserErlDir = filename:dirname(ParserErl),
  695:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_source(ParserErl),
  696:     "lry." ++ _ = lists:reverse(ParserYrl),
  697:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_source(ParserErlName, ParserErlDir,
  698:                                            [{".beam",".erl",[{"ebin","src"}]},
  699:                                             {".erl",".yrl",[{"",""}]}]),
  700: 
  701:     %% find_source automatically checks the local directory regardless of rules
  702:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_source(ParserErl),
  703:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_source(ParserErlName, ParserErlDir,
  704:                                           [{".erl",".yrl",[{"ebin","src"}]}]),
  705: 
  706:     %% find_file does not check the local directory unless in the rules
  707:     ParserYrlName = filename:basename(ParserYrl),
  708:     ParserYrlDir = filename:dirname(ParserYrl),
  709:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_file(ParserYrlName, ParserYrlDir,
  710:                                         [{"",""}]),
  711:     {error, not_found} = filelib:find_file(ParserYrlName, ParserYrlDir,
  712:                                            [{"ebin","src"}]),
  713: 
  714:     %% local directory is in the default list for find_file
  715:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_file(ParserYrlName, ParserYrlDir),
  716:     {ok, ParserYrl} = filelib:find_file(ParserYrlName, ParserYrlDir, []),
  717:     ok.
  718: 
  719: find_source_subdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  720:     BeamFile = code:which(inets), % Located in lib/inets/src/inets_app/
  721:     BeamName = filename:basename(BeamFile),
  722:     BeamDir = filename:dirname(BeamFile),
  723:     SrcName = filename:basename(BeamFile, ".beam") ++ ".erl",
  724: 
  725:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_source(BeamName, BeamDir),
  726:     SrcName = filename:basename(SrcFile),
  727: 
  728:     {error, not_found} =
  729:         filelib:find_source(BeamName, BeamDir,
  730:                             [{".beam",".erl",[{"ebin","src"}]}]),
  731:     {ok, SrcFile} =
  732:         filelib:find_source(BeamName, BeamDir,
  733:                             [{".beam",".erl",
  734:                               [{"ebin",filename:join("src", "*")}]}]),
  735: 
  736:     {ok, SrcFile} = filelib:find_file(SrcName, BeamDir),
  737: 
  738:     ok.
  739: 
  740: %% Test that all available beam files in Erlang/OTP can be
  741: %% tracked to their source files.
  742: find_source_otp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  743:     %% We do this in a peer as testcases before this may have
  744:     %% edited the code path and thus more modules show up as
  745:     %% available than should.
  746:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => [{"ERL_LIBS", false}] }),
  747:     erpc:call(
  748:       Node,
  749:       fun() ->
  750:               lists:map(
  751:                 fun F({Module, preloaded, Loaded}) ->
  752:                         F({Module, code:where_is_file(Module ++ ".beam"), Loaded});
  753: 		    F({Module, cover_compiled, Loaded}) ->
  754: 		        ok;
  755:                     F({Module, Filename, _Loaded}) ->
  756:                         case filelib:find_source(Filename) of
  757:                             {ok, _} -> ok;
  758:                             {error,_} = E ->
  759:                                 ct:fail({failed_to_find, Module, Filename, E})
  760:                         end
  761:                 end, code:all_available())
  762:       end),
  763:     peer:stop(Peer),
  764:     ok.
  765: 
  766: safe_relative_path(Config) ->
  767:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  768:     Root = filename:join(PrivDir, "filelib_SUITE_safe_relative_path"),
  769:     ok = file:make_dir(Root),
  770:     ok = file:set_cwd(Root),
  771: 
  772:     ok = file:make_dir("a"),
  773:     ok = file:set_cwd("a"),
  774:     ok = file:make_dir("b"),
  775:     ok = file:set_cwd("b"),
  776:     ok = file:make_dir("c"),
  777: 
  778:     ok = file:set_cwd(Root),
  779: 
  780:     "a" = test_srp("a"),
  781:     "a/b" = test_srp("a/b"),
  782:     "a/b" = test_srp("a/./b"),
  783:     "a/b" = test_srp("a/./b/."),
  784: 
  785:     "" = test_srp("a/.."),
  786:     "" = test_srp("a/./.."),
  787:     "" = test_srp("a/../."),
  788:     "a" = test_srp("a/b/.."),
  789:     "a" = test_srp("a/../a"),
  790:     "a" = test_srp("a/../a/../a"),
  791:     "a/b/c" = test_srp("a/../a/b/c"),
  792: 
  793:     unsafe = test_srp("a/../.."),
  794:     unsafe = test_srp("a/../../.."),
  795:     unsafe = test_srp("a/./../.."),
  796:     unsafe = test_srp("a/././../../.."),
  797:     unsafe = test_srp("a/b/././../../.."),
  798: 
  799:     unsafe = test_srp(PrivDir),                 %Absolute path.
  800: 
  801:     ok.
  802: 
  803: test_srp(RelPath) ->
  804:     Res = do_test_srp(RelPath),
  805:     Res = case do_test_srp(list_to_binary(RelPath)) of
  806:               Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  807:                   binary_to_list(Bin);
  808:               Other ->
  809:                   Other
  810:           end.
  811: 
  812: do_test_srp(RelPath) ->
  813:     {ok,Root} = file:get_cwd(),
  814:     ok = file:set_cwd(RelPath),
  815:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  816:     ok = file:set_cwd(Root),
  817:     case filelib:safe_relative_path(RelPath, Cwd) of
  818:         unsafe ->
  819:             true = length(Cwd) < length(Root),
  820:             unsafe;
  821:         "" ->
  822:             "";
  823:         SafeRelPath ->
  824:             ok = file:set_cwd(SafeRelPath),
  825:             {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  826:             true = length(Cwd) >= length(Root),
  827:             ok = file:set_cwd(Root),
  828:             SafeRelPath
  829:     end.
  830: 
  831: safe_relative_path_links(Config) ->
  832:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  833:     BaseDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "filelib_SUITE_safe_relative_path_links"),
  834:     ok = file:make_dir(BaseDir),
  835:     try
  836:         case check_symlink_support(BaseDir) of
  837:             true ->
  838:                 simple_test(BaseDir),
  839:                 inside_directory_test(BaseDir),
  840:                 nested_links_test(BaseDir),
  841:                 loop_test(BaseDir),
  842:                 loop_with_parent_test(BaseDir),
  843:                 revist_links_test(BaseDir),
  844:                 descend_climb_cwd_link_test(BaseDir),
  845:                 chained_links_same_target_name_test(BaseDir),
  846:                 ok;
  847:             false ->
  848:                 {skipped, "This platform/user can't create symlinks."}
  849:         end
  850:     after
  851:         %% This test leaves some rather nasty links that may screw with
  852:         %% z_SUITE's core file search, so we must make sure everything's
  853:         %% removed regardless of what happens.
  854:         rm_rf(BaseDir)
  855:     end.
  856: 
  857: check_symlink_support(BaseDir) ->
  858:     Canary = filename:join(BaseDir, "symlink_canary"),
  859:     Link = filename:join(BaseDir, "symlink_canary_link"),
  860:     ok = file:write_file(Canary, <<"chirp">>),
  861:     ok =:= file:make_symlink(Canary, Link).
  862: 
  863: simple_test(BaseDir) ->
  864:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "simple_test")),
  865:     file:make_symlink("..", filename:join(BaseDir, "simple_test/link")),
  866: 
  867:     unsafe = filelib:safe_relative_path("link/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "simple_test")),
  868:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("file", filename:join(BaseDir, "simple_test/link")).
  869: 
  870: inside_directory_test(BaseDir) ->
  871:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "inside_directory_test")),
  872:     file:make_symlink("..", filename:join(BaseDir, "inside_directory_test/link")),
  873: 
  874:     unsafe = filelib:safe_relative_path("link/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "inside_directory_test")),
  875:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("file", filename:join(BaseDir, "inside_directory_test/link")).
  876: 
  877: nested_links_test(BaseDir) ->
  878:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test")),
  879:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test/a")),
  880:     file:make_symlink("a/b/c", filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test/link")),
  881:     file:make_symlink("..", filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test/a/b")),
  882: 
  883:     "c/file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("link/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test")),
  884: 
  885:     file:delete(filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test/a/b")),
  886:     file:make_symlink("../..", filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test/a/b")),
  887:     unsafe = filelib:safe_relative_path("link/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "nested_links_test")).
  888: 
  889: loop_test(BaseDir) ->
  890:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_test")),
  891: 
  892:     file:make_symlink("b", filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_test/c")),
  893:     file:make_symlink("c", filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_test/b")),
  894: 
  895:     unsafe = filelib:safe_relative_path("c", filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_test")).
  896: 
  897: loop_with_parent_test(BaseDir) ->
  898:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_with_parent_test")),
  899:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_with_parent_test/bar")),
  900: 
  901:     file:make_symlink("../bar/foo", filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_with_parent_test/bar/foo")),
  902: 
  903:     unsafe = filelib:safe_relative_path("bar/foo", filename:join(BaseDir, "loop_with_parent_test")).
  904: 
  905: revist_links_test(BaseDir) ->
  906:     file:make_dir(filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  907: 
  908:     file:make_symlink(".", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test/x")),
  909:     file:make_symlink("x", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test/y")),
  910:     file:make_symlink("y", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test/z")),
  911: 
  912:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("x/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  913:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("y/x/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  914:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("x/x/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  915:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("x/y/x/y/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  916:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("x/y/z/x/y/z/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  917:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("x/x/y/y/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")),
  918:     "file" = filelib:safe_relative_path("x/z/y/x/./z/foo/../x/./y/file", filename:join(BaseDir, "revist_links_test")).
  919: 
  920: descend_climb_cwd_link_test(BaseDir) ->
  921:     Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  922: 
  923:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  924:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, "cwd")),
  925: 
  926:     ok = file:make_symlink("cwd", filename:join(Dir, "cwd_link")),
  927: 
  928:     "" = filelib:safe_relative_path("foo/..", filename:join(Dir, "cwd_link")),
  929:     "bar" = filelib:safe_relative_path("foo/../bar", filename:join(Dir, "cwd_link")),
  930:     "" = filelib:safe_relative_path("foo/..", filename:join(Dir, "cwd")),
  931:     "bar" = filelib:safe_relative_path("foo/../bar", filename:join(Dir, "cwd")).
  932: 
  933: chained_links_same_target_name_test(BaseDir) ->
  934:     Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  935: 
  936:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  937:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, "foo")),
  938:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, "foo/foo")),
  939:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:join(Dir, "foo/foo/bar")),
  940: 
  941:     ok = file:make_symlink("foo/bar", filename:join(Dir, "foo/bar")),
  942:     ok = file:make_symlink("foo/bar", filename:join(Dir, "bar")),
  943: 
  944:     "foo/foo/bar" = filelib:safe_relative_path("bar", Dir).
  945: 
  946: rm_rf(Dir) ->
  947:     case file:read_link_info(Dir) of
  948:         {ok, #file_info{type = directory}} ->
  949:             {ok, Content} = file:list_dir_all(Dir),
  950:             [ rm_rf(filename:join(Dir,C)) || C <- Content ],
  951:             file:del_dir(Dir),
  952:             ok;
  953:         {ok, #file_info{}} ->
  954:             file:delete(Dir);
  955:         _ ->
  956:             ok
  957:     end.
